question_sentence: An airliner carrying 132 people crashed into a mountainous area in what country?
Political and feminist icon Madeleine Albright died of cancer at 84. She was the first female to hold what position in the U.S.?
Amid Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, retired soccer star David Beckham handed over his Instagram account with over 70 million followers to who?
Citing “concerning online behavior,” rapper Ye’s performance during which show was cancelled?
In an effort to curb violent incidents after two shootings during spring break, what city announced a state of emergency and weekend curfew?
Disney employees walked out to call on their company to boost support for:
Quarterback Matt Ryan was traded from the Atlanta Falcons to the Indianapolis Colts. Which year did he win NFL MVP?
Which state is the best for pizza, according to a new ranking from loan company Anytime Estimate?
Which rapper released a diss track with Arby’s, directed at McDonald’s?
This week, Habitat for Humanity announced a donation from philanthropist MacKenzie Scott totalling:
What is the name of the £500m superyacht docked in a Tuscan port that allegedly belongs to Vladimir Putin?
evidence: The Scheherazade is under investigation by Italian authorities for potential links to sanctioned Russians amid allegations that the six-deck superyacht is owned by President Putin

question_sentence: US Supreme Court nominee Ketanji Brown Jackson took a drama class at Harvard alongside which Hollywood star?
evidence: Recalling her brief stint acting alongside Damon, Jackson told a lecture audience in 2017 that “although I was pretty good, I doubt he’d remember me now”

question_sentence: Reigning Australian Open and Wimbledon champion Ash Barty has shocked the world of tennis by announcing her retirement from the sport at what age?
evidence: In a video posted on Instagram, the Queensland-born world No. 1 said she was quitting tennis to “chase other dreams”

question_sentence: Which US musician has claimed that President Donald Trump asked for his advice about US foreign policy on Islamic State during a 2017 visit to the White House?
evidence: The rapper told Fox News host Tucker Carlson that Trump also picked his brain about how to deal with North Korea. For more unlikely news, sign up for our weekly Tall Tales newsletter

question_sentence: Chancellor Rishi Sunak raised the National Insurance threshold to how much in his Spring Statement?
evidence: The threshold at which employees and the self-employed start paying National Insurance contributions is currently £9,880 a year but will rise by almost £3,000 from July

question_sentence: Hotels in Venice are reportedly handing out what to guests to keep thieving seagulls at bay?
evidence: “We decided to act after a customer lifted a croissant to his mouth and a lurking seagull dived and snatched it from his hand,” the manager of one hotel battling attacks on outdoor diners told The Times

question_sentence: What is the name of the former Nicaraguan presidential candidate sentenced this week to eight years in prison for financial crimes?
evidence: Opposition leader Cristiana Chamorro was one of seven presidential hopefuls arrested on what was widely viewed as trumped-up charges ahead of last year’s national elections, in which incumbent Daniel Ortega won a fifth term

question_sentence: Which organisation launched an online archive of 400,000 aerial photographs of England dating back to 1919?
evidence: The new Aerial Photography Explorer tool is intended to help people get their buildings listed but also gives users a chance to see how the nation has changed over the past century

question_sentence: The average house price in the UK has hit a record high of how much, according to the latest data from Rightmove?
evidence: The property website said typical asking prices in March were up by 1.7%, or £5,760, from February – the biggest monthly rise for this time of year in 18 years

question_sentence: A lawsuit filed by Donald Trump against Hillary Clinton has accused her of what?
choices: ‘Racketeering’ and a ‘conspiracy to commit injurious falsehood’
evidence: Trump has accused his former presidential rival and “her cohorts” of trying to rig the 2016 election by linking his campaign to Russia, in a conspiracy that made Watergate “pale in comparison”

question_sentence: Confirmation hearings for Supreme Court nominee Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson began this week. Where did she earn her law degree?
evidence: Ketanji Brown Jackson is a graduate of Harvard Law School. She is also a former assistant federal public defender and has sat on lower US courts for nearly a decade.

question_sentence: As many Americans struggle with high gas prices, what are some states doing to help drivers save money at the pump?
choices: Limiting how much gas people can buy
Banning large trucks from filling up their tanks
Paying drivers to switch to electric vehicles
evidence: Some states are temporarily suspending their gas tax to reduce the pain at the pump. Georgia announced a suspension of its $0.29 cent tax per gallon on regular fuel. And in Maryland, lawmakers passed a gas tax holiday for 30 days that ends April 16.

question_sentence: The Biden administration formally determined this week that the military of which country committed genocide and crimes against humanity?
evidence: The Biden administration formally determined that Myanmar’s military committed genocide and crimes against humanity against the Rohingya, a stateless Muslim minority encompassing about 1 million people.

question_sentence: What is the most popular dog breed in the US?
evidence: The American Kennel Club unleashed its annual list of the most popular dog breeds this week — and, for the 31st year in a row, the Labrador retriever placed first!

question_sentence: Which state battled hundreds of wildfires this week?
evidence: Firefighters have been trying to protect people and homes in Texas after 178 wildfires burned more than 108,000 acres across the state. Authorities said increased wildfire activity was due to “critical fire weather and high winds.”

question_sentence: How often are some public health experts saying Covid-19 shots may be needed going forward?
evidence: Some scientists think we might be rolling up our sleeves annually for Covid-19 shots, similar to how flu shots are recommended each fall.

question_sentence: President Biden issued an urgent warning to American business leaders this week, telling them to do what immediately?
evidence: Biden told business leaders to strengthen their companies’ cyber defenses immediately because Russian President Vladimir Putin is likely to use cyber attacks as a form of retaliation against the US in response to the economic sanctions imposed on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine.

question_sentence: Which popular daytime talk show will be ending after 31 seasons?
evidence: “Maury” is ending after 31 seasons. The show is well known for its paternity tests and guests with scandalous secrets, and host Maury Povich is the longest-running daytime talk show host in TV history.

question_sentence: Which US city had the worst air quality last year, according to a new report by IQAir?
evidence: Out of the more than 2,400 US cities analyzed, Los Angeles air remained the most polluted, despite seeing a 6% decrease compared to 2020.

question_sentence: Which professional tennis player shocked the sports world this week by announcing her retirement?
evidence: World No. 1 Ashleigh Barty announced her retirement two months after winning the Australian Open women’s singles. The 25-year-old athlete said she wants to “chase other dreams.”
